author: sendmoodz
content:
<@469936733073702915> is raising concerns about EIP-1153 (TSTORE) causing issues with account abstraction along with the suggestion to remove it from Cancun, and I just want to make everyone aware of the context and some rebuttals before the next ACD so it need not be argued further on the call.

OP: https://x.com/Agusx1211/status/1752054288187011277
My rebuttal: https://x.com/sendmoodz/status/1752092489412985266
<@727296082484265073> : https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-1153-transient-storage-opcodes/553/132
<@244849478371246080>: https://x.com/real_philogy/status/1752317048720347194?s=20
Vectorized: https://x.com/optimizoor/status/1752070265159450754?s=20
jtriley: https://x.com/jtriley_eth/status/1752387088991821999
Memes:
- https://x.com/jtriley_eth/status/1752362714419126488
- https://x.com/jtriley_eth/status/1750925063451529414
- https://x.com/alpeh_v/status/1752371363736621437

In my opinion, the argument holds no water. It is no different from the argument that TSTORE could be used in a way that hurts smart contract composability (e.g. not clearing a reentrancy lock) that was discussed ad nauseam with the solidity team, for which they introduced a compiler warning with any usage of TSTORE.
